H0.text: Halite is the mineral most likely to be found in all three major rock types—metamorphic, igneous, and sedimentary.

H1.text: Quartz is the mineral most likely to be found in all three major rock types—metamorphic, igneous, and sedimentary.

H2.text: Gypsum is the mineral most likely to be found in all three major rock types—metamorphic, igneous, and sedimentary.

H3.text: Sulfur is the mineral most likely to be found in all three major rock types—metamorphic, igneous, and sedimentary.

A4.text: Quartz is a common constituent of metamorphic rocks such as schist, gneiss, and quartzite, as well as igneous rocks like granite and sedimentary rocks such as sandstone and shale.
